text: Wamundila Muliokela (born 15 May 1942) is a Zambian former politician. He served as Member of the National Assembly for Chililabombwe from 2002 until 2006, and as Minister of Defence between 2005 and 2006. ==Biography== Prior to entering politics, Muliokela worked as a sociologist.Wamundila Muliokela National Assembly of Zambia He contested the 2001 general elections as the Movement for Multi-Party Democracy candidate in Chililabombwe and was elected to the National Assembly after the incumbent Chililabombwe MP Sikota Wina decided to contest the Mulobezi instead.Zambia Election Passport He was subsequently appointed Deputy Minister of Defence.Zambia: Army officers ready to take off for peacekeeping mission The Post, 21 June 2002 In March 2005 he became Minister of Defence.Country Report: Zambia Economist Intelligence Unit In the 2006 general elections he was defeated by Esther Banda of the Patriotic Front. ==References== Category:1942 births Category:Living people Category:Movement for Multi-Party Democracy politicians Category:Members of the National Assembly (Zambia) Category:Defence Ministers of Zambia
title: Wamundila Muliokela
